title: Billing and Claims Management UI
description:
Comprehensive Healthcare Billing Dashboard with Claims Management System

Build a full-featured billing dashboard for healthcare claims that provides list management, filtering, status tracking, and detailed claim inspection capabilities.

Core Features:

Claims List View:
- Display paginated table of all claims with columns: Claim ID, Patient Name, Date Submitted, Total Amount, Current Status
- Implement multi-criteria filtering (status, date range, amount range, patient name/ID)
- Add sortable columns (ascending/descending on all key fields)
- Include bulk actions support (export selected claims, batch status updates if applicable)
- Show claim count and total amount summaries
- Support both pagination and infinite scroll options for dataset navigation

Status Tracking System:
- Define claim lifecycle stages: Submitted → Under Review → Approved/Denied → Paid/Closed
- Implement visual status indicators with consistent color coding (e.g., yellow=pending, green=approved, red=denied, blue=paid)
- Create timeline or progress bar visualization showing current stage and completed steps
- Display status change history with timestamps and actor information
- Support status-based filtering and grouping

Detailed Claim View:
- Patient information section: Full name, DOB, member ID, contact details
- Insurance details: Payer name, policy number, group ID, coverage dates
- Service details table: Date of service, CPT/procedure codes, descriptions, quantities, unit costs, line totals
- Financial summary: Subtotal, adjustments, patient responsibility, insurance payment, outstanding balance
- Status history panel: Chronological log of all status changes with dates, times, and responsible parties
- Document attachments: List of supporting documents (EOBs, medical records, prior authorizations) with view/download capability
- Notes/comments section: Internal notes and adjudication remarks
- Payment tracking: Payment date, method, reference number, remittance details

Dashboard KPIs and Analytics:
- Total claims count (overall and by status category)
- Total dollar amount in each status bucket
- Approval rate percentage
- Average processing time per claim
- Aging report (claims by days outstanding)
- Top denial reasons (if applicable)

Search and Navigation:
- Global search box supporting: Claim ID, Patient Name, Member ID, Date ranges
- Quick filters for common views (e.g., "My Claims," "Pending Review," "Denied Claims")
- Breadcrumb navigation when drilling into claim details
- Return to list functionality preserving previous filter/sort state

Technical Requirements:

Data Model:
- Define Claim object schema including all required fields and relationships
- Establish Patient, Payer, Service Line, StatusHistory, and Attachment data structures
- Determine API endpoints needed (GET /claims, GET /claims/:id, GET /claims/:id/history, etc.)
- Plan for real-time updates using WebSocket, polling, or server-sent events

Performance Optimization:
- Implement virtualized scrolling for lists exceeding 100 items
- Use debounced search and filter inputs
- Cache frequently accessed claim details
- Lazy load claim details and attachments
- Consider backend pagination vs client-side filtering trade-offs

State Management:
- Choose state management pattern (Redux, Context API, Zustand, etc.)
- Plan optimistic updates for status changes
- Handle concurrent edit scenarios
- Implement proper cache invalidation strategy

UI/UX Considerations:
- Mobile-responsive layout (minimum tablet support, consider mobile phone constraints)
- Loading skeletons for all async operations
- Empty states with helpful messaging
- Error boundaries and user-friendly error messages
- Accessibility compliance (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, screen reader support)
- Toast notifications for actions (claim updated, export complete, etc.)

Security and Compliance:
- Verify user authentication and session management
- Implement role-based access control (if multiple user types exist)
- Ensure HIPAA compliance for PHI display
- Audit logging for claim access and modifications
- Secure handling of document attachments

Edge Cases and Error Handling:
- No claims available (empty state)
- API timeout or failure scenarios
- Invalid claim ID in URL
- Missing or incomplete claim data
- Large attachment files
- Network interruption during data fetch
- Concurrent updates to same claim
- Filter combinations returning no results

Success Criteria:
- Users can view and locate any claim within 3 clicks
- Dashboard loads initial view in under 2 seconds
- Search results return in under 1 second
- All claim details display accurately and completely
- Status changes reflect in real-time or within 5 seconds
- Interface remains responsive with datasets of 10,000+ claims
- Zero PHI data exposure vulnerabilities
